name: Outrigger Phi Phi Island Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girfriend and I booked via Trailfinders in Manchester. When we arrived at Phi Phi harbour we were a bit concerned about how remote this place might be....However - what a place! I cannot speak highy enough about the resort - it was amazing, heaven on earth. Even though it is remote, the fact it is so simply beautiful makes up for that. We hired a 'tuk tuk water taxi' for an entire night for £25 that took us to Phi Phi harbour and waited for us - unbelievable value.
reviews.title: The Perfect Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This must be one of the most remote/idilic places on earth - incredible. I will definitely go back. In fact, I want to live there!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this place for our honeymoon via Global Online reservations - a Phuklet based web booking service. Highly recommend this site. We had a fantastic four days there, from the reception at Phi Phi, the longtail boat ride to the secluded stretch of beach, the welcome drink, the fantastic hut (we had the lowest room option - superior, which was quite luxurious), to the food and fantastic service with a smile, The spa was our fave of course.
reviews.title: What a beautiful place!

likes.liked: — Just everything, this place is fantastic.
likes.disliked: — There was nothing I did not like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side is that being a secluded place, you end up doing most activities, eating and drinking there which is more expensive than doing it privately, but when you convert it to AUD it really isn't that bad.
reviews.title: A true paradise (been there 3 times and will go back for more)
nice but expensive
reviews.text: There is a longtail boat service to Phi Phi proper - at 200 Baht round trip, but it leaves at 12 and returns at 5 which restricts plannign your own excursions (you can hire your own long tail boat back, but it seemed too hard for us).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The word paradise does not do this hotel and location justice, it is completely out of this world and by far the amazing, beautiful and perfect plave I have ever been in my entire life.
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!
Island Paradise
reviews.text: You arrive at Tonsai Bay on the ferry and there is someone at the port ready to meet you straight away. They take your bags and guide you to the long tail boat that takes you to the resort. When you arrive at the resort there is someone else to greet you with cold towels and a gorgeous coconut drink. The rooms are lush, they are all air-conditioned, quiet and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are all friendly and helpful and nothing is too much trouble. The beach is beautiful with white sands and clear water, and the scenary surrounding is unbelievable, everytime I looked at it I couldn't believe I was actually there! The pool is huge and has a vanishing edge, it is clean and never crowded. There are sunbeds surrounding the pool, and you never have to worry about getting one like you do in some resorts! Every time we went there there were sunbeds available! You do get given beach towels in your room but you can also pick them up from the side of the pool, I would suggest doing this as they are bigger than the ones in your room.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

likes.liked: — The Location and the Lay Out of where the Resort is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend learned to scuba dive whilst there and the instructors were great, very professional and keen to show you lots of places. He saw a variety of fish and even some leopard sharks!
reviews.title: Great time in Phi Phi - Detailed review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also took a longtail boat trip around Ko Phi Phi Leh where we spent the day snorkiling and swimming. I would thoroughly recommend this as it was amazing! The views are stunning.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip:
reviews.title: Phi Phi Paradise on earth !

likes.liked: — Phi Phi islands and snorkeling tours, nice beachfront bungalow, wonderful wild nature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Twinpalms Phuket (5days), Surin Beach
reviews.title: A litle piece of paradise

reviews.text: - PhiPhi Island Village (3days), Phi Phi Don
reviews.title: Paradise. I Want to come back for my honeymoon

likes.liked: — I cannot describe how beautiful the whole place is.
likes.disliked: — It was isolated and remote. You can get tired of just sitting by the pool all day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Central Krabi Bay Resort (5days), Ao Nang
reviews.title: Paradise on Phi Phi

likes.liked: — Stunning beach location, beautiful bungalow and friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was just dreaming of getting to PhiPhi islands, and from the first seconds this dream came true.
reviews.title: Second time back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 10 days in a beach front junior suite which was very nice, the rooms were large, the bathroom huge and nice sitting areas outside.
reviews.title: Great Snorkling

likes.disliked: — The Noise from the early morning boats

reviews.text: As I had read before this resort is expensive for eating and drinking so although the small restaraunts out the back are limited they are certinally more tastier and cheaper.
reviews.title: scary journey, nice hotel

likes.disliked: — leaking roof, open plan toilet and bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that supprised us was the noise of the boats starting up and heading out at 4:30 in the morning, we were woken up about 4 times during our stay by a loud diesel engine that seemed to go on for a long time.
reviews.title: Pure experience!

likes.liked: — The towels - freshly renewed everyday on time
likes.disliked: — They could have added lemongrass onto our garden... then we could have had brekkie on the pavilion too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place though and very enjoyable for couples and familys
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

reviews.text: We had a lovely 10 night stay at the Phi Phi Island Village. The grounds and facilities are really superb, the pool is huge and welcoming, the staff delightful and the breakfasts are excellent. The dive school got rave reviews from my husband and daughter and I loved my trip to the spa.
reviews.title: The Best Ever

likes.disliked: — food can be a bit iffy lots of msg

aka: Phi Phi Island Village Beach Hotel
description: A dream-like boutique resort situated on a private 800 metre stretch of pristine white sand beach lapped by the turqoise waters of the Andaman Sea. The resort is set on 70 acres of coconut palm plantations, in the privacy of Loh Ba Gao Bay on Phi Phi Island. Accommodation is comprised of 144 traditional Thai style bungalows and 12 exclusively private Hillside Pool Villas.
